channel.title: [PI] Compiler Help [PI]
channel.description: Okay Guys, I Just Got A New Source And I Got WHOLE NEW Files... I Fixed The Compiler In My Source But When I Compile In My Client (Useing Same Code As Source) It Looks Like This: [code]javac: file not found: src\server\event\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .[/code] How exactly Do I Fix That? Any Ideas? EDIT: This Is My Compiler Code: [code]@echo off title Abandoned Dreams Compiler! "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java src\server\model\players\Quests\*.java src\server\model\players\Content\*.java pause[/code]

item.title: [PI] Compiler Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Abandoned_Dreams Abandoned Dreams
item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Which one isn’t working…[/quote]They Both Were Not You Helped Fix Client, Now I Need Help With Source Compiler, The Files Are Not Separated Like That One, I Do Not Need, cd (FILE NAME)… How Would I Fix This One?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Compiler Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Abandoned_Dreams Abandoned Dreams
item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]That’s the problem. Right under the title (on a new line) type in:
cd Files[/quote]Woops Forgot That, Now I Feel Like A Idiot There But, What ABout Source, Still Don’t Work.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Compiler Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Abandoned_Dreams Abandoned Dreams
item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

I Vain I:

In the client folder, are the .java files in the same folder as the compiler our the same folder as the.class files?

.java and .class are in the “Files” File

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Compiler Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Abandoned_Dreams Abandoned Dreams
item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Is the compiler in the same directory as both the .java and .class files, or are they separately packaged?[/quote]I Don’t Know What You Mean Lol(Sorry) But My Client And Source Files Are Seperated, (Not In One File)

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Compiler Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Abandoned_Dreams Abandoned Dreams
item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]We’re going to shit because idiots like you can’t read what a damn compiler its echoing out. You spam-post topics, then get a new bar, seriously?

OT: remove the . after cp and before the *[/quote]Still Didn’t Work, And I Am New To Coding I Learn This Way, Have You Ever Seen Me Post Something Someone Taught Me Before? No, Because I Learned It And If I Forgot I Go To My Old Posts Until I Find.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Compiler Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Abandoned_Dreams Abandoned Dreams
item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

Honestly, Can I Ever Trust Moparscape To Give Me A Good Answer? This Community Is Going To Shit Because Of People Like You…

OT: I Changed My Compiler Code To This:

@echo off COLOR 02 title Runescape Private Server Compiler- Pwn0r "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause
But It Still Don’t Work??? Any Suggestions Or Ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Compiler Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Abandoned_Dreams Abandoned Dreams
item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

Okay Guys, I Just Got A New Source And I Got WHOLE NEW Files… I Fixed The Compiler In My Source But When I Compile In My Client (Useing Same Code As Source) It Looks Like This:

javac: file not found: src\server\event\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .
How exactly Do I Fix That? Any Ideas?
EDIT: This Is My Compiler Code:

@echo off title Abandoned Dreams Compiler! "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java src\server\model\players\Quests\*.java src\server\model\players\Content\*.java pause

Read full topic
